info.game_comments:
1997 Power Players Week game 1.
From DAR Constitution Hall in Washington, D.C.

(1, 1).clue: In 1954 he became the first & only U.S. senator elected by a write-in vote; he's still there

(2, 1).clue: This world record-holding sprinter is the star of the video "The Flo-Jo Workout"

(3, 1).clue: This featuer will catch the error in the first line of our clue but not in the final lion

(4, 1).clue: Marketed as the soap that floats, it was born in Cincinnati in 1879

(5, 1).clue: In this state you can Kissimmee once, twice & once again, as it's a river, lake & city

(1, 2).clue: In 1996 this Mississippian succeeded Bob Dole as Senate majority leader

(2, 2).clue: In May 1954 it took Roger Bannister 3 minutes 59.4 seconds to cover this distance

(3, 2).clue: This 2-part process of moving text can be done with scisssors & glue or with commands

(4, 2).clue: The American version of rugby, it was first played at college level in 1869 when Rutgers beat Princeton

(5, 2).clue: At its north end, the Dead Sea receives this river

(1, 3).clue: This California governor has defeated 2 Democratic women, Dianne Feinstein & Kathleen Brown

(2, 3).clue: He won 5 Olympic golds in running events not to mention 4 consecutive long jump medals

(4, 3).clue: Mid-19th century Chinese cooks working on the western railroads devised this dish of odds & ends served over rice

(5, 3).clue: The James, Potomac & Chester Rivers all flow into this bay

(1, 4).clue: Chairman of the House Ways & Means Committee, he succeeded George Bush in Texas' 7th District

(2, 4).clue: Now an Anaheim Angel, this outfielder has led the American League in steals for 11 seasons

(4, 4).clue: From the company that made it famous, it's the nickname of the "sound" heard here("Baby Love", for example)

(5, 4).clue: It's still working on deepening the Grand Canyon

(1, 5).clue: In the 1993 film "Born Yesterday", this future U.S. senator played a U.S. senator

(2, 5).clue: On Oct. 31, 1996 this race horse retired after "smoking" the tracks with 19 wins

(5, 5).clue: The river known as the "Great Man-Made River" in Libya reaches into this desert

(1, 1).clue: South Carolina senator Ernest F. Hollings shares this nickname with fellow Democrat Walter Mondale

(2, 1).clue: In this Andrew Lloyd Webber musical, an actress becomes the most powerful woman in Argentina

(3, 1).clue: This Lumpy Brannum character was created as the "Mr. Outdoors" to the Captain's "Mr. Indoors"

(4, 1).clue: The shore of this island is indented by numerous bays including Donegal Bay & Belfast Lough

(5, 1).clue: On Dec. 11, 1996 this country agreed to search its banks for the assets of Holocaust victims

(1, 2).clue: This Ohioan is flying high as the ranking Democrat on the Senate Governmental Affairs Committee

(2, 2).clue: Sophocles wrote 2 plays about this title king who "wrecks" his life by marrying his mother

(4, 2).clue: Over 700,000 square miles, or about 84%, of this island is covered by an icecap

(5, 2).clue: A German court convicted her father of failing to pay taxes of $7.4 million on tennis earnings

(1, 3).clue: This West Virginian has served in the U.S. Senate longer than any current Democrat -- 38 years

(2, 3).clue: This classic musical about a 19th C. ruler returned to Broadway in 1996; it features the following:("Shall We Dance")

(4, 3).clue: The largest & most westernmost island in the West Indies, it's the world's largest sugar exporter

(5, 3).clue: Philippe Bourguignon left the chairmanship of Eurodisney to join this resort "club"

(1, 4).clue: This Nebraskan is vice chairman of the U.S. Senate Select Committee on Intelligence

(2, 4).clue: A famous D.C. address, it was the title of a 1976 musical; Lerner felt low when it flopped

(3, 4).clue: Terrytoons created this hero & Mighty Manfred the Wonder Dog especially for the show

(4, 4).clue: In 1891 the first fossils of Homo erectus were discovered on this Indonesian island

(5, 4).clue: In 1997 Tony Blair's new government gave this bank control of interest rates

(6, 4).clue: Samuel Blanc founded this company during the Depression to make troubles go "Down the Drain"

(1, 5).clue: In 1994 this incumbent Florida governor narrowly beat GOP challenger Jeb Bush

(2, 5).clue: As a character in "Annie", this president sings "A New Deal for Christmas" with Daddy Warbucks

(3, 5).clue: Bunny Rabbit liked to trick the Captain out of carrots; Mr. Moose liked to drop these on him

(4, 5).clue: L'Anse aux Meadows on this eastern Canadian island is the first authenticated Viking site in North America

(5, 5).clue: In July 1996 a war crimes warrant was issued for this political leader of Bosnia's Serbs

(6, 5).clue: It's a subtle way of promoting brands by having movie characters drive, wear or drink them

(0, 0).clue: This 19th century speech included the line "The world will little note, nor long remember what we say here..."
